level.text: The fee imposed by § 44-653 shall not be due and payable until such time that the federal Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services approves the Medicaid State Plan amendment authorizing the Medicaid payments described in § 44-655.
The fee imposed by § 44-653 shall cease to be imposed, and any moneys remaining in the Fund shall be refunded to hospital providers in proportion to the amounts paid by them, if:
The Department makes changes in its rules that reduce the hospital inpatient or outpatient Medicaid payment rates, including adjustment payment rates, in effect on October 1, 2012; or

The payments to hospitals required under § 44-655 are modified in any way other than to secure federal approval of such payments as described in § 44-655 or are not eligible for federal matching funds under Title XIX of the Social Security Act.
The fee imposed by § 44-653 shall not take effect or shall cease to be imposed if the fee is determined to be an impermissible tax under Title XIX of the Social Security Act.

Should the fee imposed by § 44-653 not take effect or cease to be imposed, moneys in the Fund derived from the imposed fee shall be disbursed in accordance with § 44-655 to the extent federal matching is available. If federal matching is not available due to a determination by the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services that the provider fee is impermissible, any remaining moneys shall be refunded to hospital providers in proportion to the amounts paid by them.

level.heading: Short Title
level.text: Section 5071 of D.C. Law 20-61 provided that Subtitle H of Title V of the act may be cited as the "Medicaid Hospital Outpatient Supplemental Payment Act of 2013".
